pullRequest.body:
The first step towards removing `CovariantClass` and `ContravariantClass`.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: I'm sceptical about adding more ways to say the same things. Is there some previous discussion about the pros and cons here?

I agree with Kim.

As you know, I introduced the analogous [docs#PosMulMono](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#PosMulMono) and its friends a while ago, thinking that it was a good idea.

I've come to regret this decision later on, since I think that it adds very little extra understanding to someone who does not know what `Co(ntra)variant` models and adds yet another name to have to come to grips with for everyone else.

For this reason, I would recommend not adding these `abbrev`s.

The other place where a similar "new name" for a `Co(ntra)variant`-like assumption is [docs#PosSMulMono](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Module/Defs.html#PosSMulMono).  However, these have their justification in helping typeclass search not get derailed.

Does this sound reasonable?  :smile:
I agree with Kim and Damiano
The plan was #13124 removing `CovariantClass` and `ContravariantClass`. But it's only a small performance improvement for the entire mathlib.
And according to [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/TC.20slowness/near/453991380) I will reopen this PR.

### PR summary [e287c943d5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13467/commits/e287c943d5cfe2d2842ca4b10cb6e88dbdeb35c1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Group.mulLeftReflectLE_of_mulLeftMono`
`+ Group.mulLeftReflectLT_of_mulLeftStrictMono`
`+ Group.mulRightReflectLE_of_mulRightMono`
`+ Group.mulRightReflectLT_of_mulRightStrictMono`
`+ mulLeftMono_of_mulLeftStrictMono`
`+ mulLeftReflectLT_of_mulLeftMono`
`+ mulLeftStrictMono_of_mulLeftReflectLE`
`+ mulRightMono_of_mulLeftMono`
`+ mulRightMono_of_mulRightStrictMono`
`+ mulRightReflectLE_of_mulLeftReflectLE`
`+ mulRightReflectLT_of_mulLeftReflectLT`
`+ mulRightReflectLT_of_mulRightMono`
`+ mulRightStrictMono_of_mulLeftStrictMono`
`+ mulRightStrictMono_of_mulRightReflectLE`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
I'm confused. Zulip said you should add these, but *remove* `CovariantClass` and `ContravariantClass`, not just make abbreviations to them.
This PR is a part of #13124. The new definitions are separated out here for review.

Most diffs in #13124 are renames, separated into #13154. So the new typeclasses in this PR are temporary aliases rather than the final definition. Eventually `CovariantClass` and `ContravariantClass` will be removed and the definitions of the new typeclasses will be replaced in #13124.

@semorrison and @adomani, are you on board with this now? When I commented earlier I thought we were just adding `abbrev`s, but given the discussion on Zulip, it seems this is more principled. Thoughts?

Given the speed improvements, I am definitely more in favour of this change now, than I was before!

Did I hallucinate that this PR had been `!bench`ed?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.
